author: Staff Reporter
text:
Coimbatore Corporation aided by the inter-departmental committee is addressing queries raised by the two prospective bidders for the 24x7 drinking water supply scheme.

According to sources, after the civic body floated invited proposals from eligible companies, French company Veolia and a company that is part of the Zee conglomerate responded.

The two companies after studying the request for quotation (RFQ) had raised over 200 questions. The civic body was studying and addressing those. If need be, the civic body will publish a corrigendum to its notice calling for RFQ and then proceed to approve one of the two companies.

The sources also say that the companies have also asked for study to make some initial assessment on the ground.
title: Corporation to address queries by bidders
